articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major 7th in C# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major 7th in C# (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played individually rather than simultaneously. In this case, the Major 7th arpeggio in the key of C# (Shape: A) consists of the following notes: C#, E#, G#, B#. This arpeggio creates a lush and dreamy sound due to the inclusion of the major 7th interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (C#)
- Major 3rd (E#)
- Perfect 5th (G#)
- Major 7th (B#) 

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Major 7th arpeggio in C# is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and funky styles of music. It adds a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to compositions, often used to create a sense of tension and release due to the dissonance of the major 7th interval.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Major 7th arpeggio in C#:
1. *'Misty'* by Erroll Garner
2. *'The Chicken'* by Jaco Pastorius
3. *'Virtual Insanity'* by Jamiroquai
